conclusion: Coach bus travels at 20 m/s, puppy 45 meters ahead, reaction time 0.5 seconds.
Velocity-time graph shows velocity on y-axis and time on x-axis, line decreases from 20 m/s to 0 m/s at 4.5 seconds.
Graph is a straight line indicating constant deceleration.
Deceleration can be found by calculating the slope of the line.
Initial velocity is 20 m/s, final velocity is 0 m/s, deceleration time is 4 seconds.
Reaction time is 0.5 seconds, bus continues at constant speed before deceleration.
Deceleration starts at 0.5 s and ends at 4.5 s, lasting 4 seconds.
During reaction time, bus moves at 20 m/s for 0.5 s, covering 10 meters.
During deceleration, calculate distance using formula: Distance2 = 20 * 4 + (1/2) * (-5) * (4)² = 40 meters.
Total distance covered is 50 meters, bus overshoots puppy by 5 meters.
Bus stops 5 meters past puppy's position, puppy is not safe.
Rechecking calculations confirms bus passes 5 meters beyond puppy.
